name: Branchtender Linden
descriptions: Branchtender Linden is a member of the Treeminders and one of Oasis' armed defenders in Fallout 3.
Prior to his arrival in Oasis, Linden was a member of the Brotherhood Outcasts, and, by extension, was once a member of the Brotherhood of Steel.
Upon meeting the Lone Wanderer, Linden is friendly and welcoming towards them, but will become angry and frustrated if they decide to insult the Treeminders.
Linden is loyal to the ideals of Leaf Mother Laurel, and fully believes in sharing Oasis's gifts with the rest of the Capital Wasteland.
Linden is a common name for trees of genus Tilia. All of the human residents in Oasis have horticultural names.

topics.response_text: Was it too much to ask to expect some civility from you? Bah. Get out of my sight.

topics.topic: MS10FinTLRewardTree Father Birch said you may have a gift for me?
topics.topic_text: Leaf Mother Laurel said you may have a gift for me?
topics.response_text: I've never known someone to show as much caring as you did towards us. It seems to be rare to run into anyone like that anymore.

topics.topic_text: What's your opinion of Tree Father Birch and Leaf Mother Laurel?
topics.response_text: I've only known them for a very short time, but when I first arrived they immediately took me in and treated me just like a son.

topics.topic_text: Any information you could give me on the caves below Oasis would be helpful.
topics.response_text: Oasis is located near what used to be an old mining town before the bombs fell.
I'll remain here and help in anyway that I can. I owe them my life, and I intend to repay that debt until my last breath.
Well, I'm not so sure the Great One is a god... I mean, I don't believe in that sort of thing.

topics.topic_text: So, how did you end up here?
topics.response_text: I was found dying in the Wastes not far from here by a trader caravan. They knew about this place and brought me to Bloomseer Poplar.

topics.topic_text: Dying? How awful! What happened to you?
topics.response_text: I was a Brotherhood of Steel Outcast. We had a deep patrol out here, looking for some tech and then got jumped by some Deathclaws.

topics.topic_text: Why'd you stay here after you recovered?
topics.response_text: I felt I owed these people for bringing me back from the brink.

topics.topic_text: I'm not sure I could live with these loonies.
topics.response_text: You have a lot of nerve! We've shown you nothing but hospitality and then instead of thanks, you chose to hurl insults?

topics.topic_text: What did you have to do to become a Treeminder?
topics.response_text: I sort of fell into it I guess. I woke up here and I just stayed. After a while, I became one of them.
I'd prefer not to talk about it. Some people wouldn't appreciate my past.

conversation.response_text: Leave us and never look back, Outsider.
In the name of His Frondescence, I call His wrath upon you, so that, wherever you may go, you bear it with you...
